intro: Anthistiria junghuhniana var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf anthistiria, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
